    • Constructor Detail

      • ODBMining

        public ODBMining​(java.lang.String dbHost,
                 int port,
                 java.lang.String pw,
                 java.lang.String uID)
          throws java.lang.Exception
        Contructor - connect to JODB server
        Note:
        - Serialized POJO object as key must have an implemented equals-method
        - Leading or trailing spaces are consisdered as part of a string
        - Array variable is not supported by SQL and SELECT operations
        - By select with comparator (EQ/LT/LE/GT/GE) EQ is the only choice if comp. value is a string
        Parameters:
        dbHost - String, Host of JODB Server
        port - int, port number
        pw - String, User's password
        uID - String, User's ID
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - for IO, NIO, etc.

      • selectAll

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> selectAll​(java.lang.String dbName,
                                                       java.lang.String pat)
                                                throws java.lang.Exception
        SelectAll return all serialized objects that match the given string pattern
        Pattern with wildcard * for a string or ? for 1 letter can be used (e.g. J*y or Jo?y)
        Multiple ? or * is NOT allowed.
        Example: selectAll(dbName, "Joe") or selectAll(dbName, "J?e")
        Parameters:
        dbName - String, Database Name
        pat - String, the selecting pattern
        Returns:
        arrayList of all objects with the given pattern
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if dbName or pattern is null or Exception from JODB Server

      • selectAll

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> selectAll​(java.lang.String dbName,
                                                       java.lang.String vName,
                                                       java.lang.String pat)
                                                throws java.lang.Exception
        select all objects with the vName that matches the pattern.
        Note:
        - vName must be a String instance. Otherwise the returned list has NO element.
        - Pattern with wildcard * for a string or ? for 1 letter can be used (e.g. J*y or Jo?y)
        - Multiple ? or * is NOT allowed.
        Example: selectAll(dbName, vName, "Joe") or selectAll(dbName, vName, "J*e")
        Parameters:
        dbName - String, Database Name
        vName - String, variable Name (non array variable)
        pat - String, the selecting pattern
        Returns:
        arrayList of all objects with the given pattern
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if dbName or or vName or pattern is null or Exception from JODB Server

      • SQL

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> SQL​(java.lang.String dbName,
                                                 java.lang.String sql)
                                          throws java.lang.Exception
        SQL-like select
        A SQL-like statement is for example:
        "select varName_1 eq value_1 and varName_2 gt value_2"
        "select varName_1 eq value_1 or varName_2 gt value_2"
        Conjunctor (and, or), Comparator (lt, le, eq, gt, ge) can be in upper or lower case.
        Exception is arisen if Conjunctor or Comparator is invalid.
        Rules:
        Comparison: Var_1 Comparator Var_2
        Conjunction: Comparison_1 and/or comparison_2 and/or ....
        value can contain wildcard *, ? if it is a string (otherwise: exception)
        Note:
        - Float or double must be led by 0 if it is less than 1. Exp.: 0.123
        - Negative value is preceded by a hyphen (MINUS sign). Positive sign (+) can be omitted.
        - VarName must be a non-array variable
        - Comparator of VarName of string instance can only be EQ. Otherwise the returned list has NO0 element.
        - value of primitive/BigInteger/BigDecimal must be nummeric. Otherwise the returned list has NO element.
        - value of String instance must be a String (e.g. for an 1 = ""+1). Otherwise the returned list has NO element.
        Parameters:
        dbName - String, Database Name
        sql - sql-like statement. Example: name eq Joe and income gt 10000
        Returns:
        ArrayList of all Objects that match the criteria of sql
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Exception from JODB Server

      • selectAll

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> selectAll​(java.lang.String dbName,
                                                       java.lang.String comp,
                                                       double val)
                                                throws java.lang.Exception
        select all objects that match the criterion of value
        Parameters:
        dbName - String, Database name
        comp - String, LT: Less, LE: LessEqual, EQ: Equal, GE: GreaterEqual, GT: Greater
        val - double, comparing value
        Returns:
        arrayList of all objects that match the criterion.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if dbName is null or Exception from JODB Server

        allObjects(dbName);
        Parameters:
        dbName - String, Database Name
        Returns:
        arrayList of all objects with the given dbName
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if dbName or clsName is null or Exception from JODB Server
